trends: There have been 82 other sightings in Cincinnati
There were no other sightings in Cincinnati on or around July 31st 1977
Summary: Glowing orange sphere made abrupt turns and ascend
divs: Sighting DetailsLegacy case entered by MUFON of OH. It was a clear evening in Colerain Township (Hamilton County), suburbanCincinnati, OH, in Aug 1977. A 16-year-old male was sitting on the front porchof his house, daydreaming and watching the night sky. The temperature wasbetween 60 and 70 degrees with little wind. At about 10:00 p.m. the witnessfirst noticed an object that he thought may have been a meteorite. "I was caland continued watching....The object was shaped like a baseball, bright orangeand didnt leave a trail. There was no noise discernible. The object appearedsolid, blowed and made a few abrupt turns. Thats when I knew it wasnt ameteorite."As he watched, the object moved from N to E, then N again and then beganascending. The object disappeared as it went straight up. Viewing time wasapproximately 15 seconds. The witness continued to watch for the object forabout an hour, but didnt see it.
